meanings.definition: A person who exposes wrongdoing or illegal activity within an organization.
meanings.sent1: Whistleblowers help keep companies honest by revealing any bad behavior.
meanings.sent2: The whistleblowers bravely spoke up about the corruption they witnessed at work.
meanings.sent3: The whistleblower decided to blow the whistle on the shady dealings in the company.
meanings.sent4: She was like a beacon of truth, shining light on the darkness as a whistleblower.
meanings.sent5: The image of the whistleblower standing up against injustice stayed with me.

meanings.definition: The act of reporting misconduct or illegal activity within an organization.
meanings.sent1: Reporting misconduct is an important duty for whistleblowers to protect others.
meanings.sent2: The whistleblowers' reports led to the uncovering of the embezzlement scheme.
meanings.sent3: The whistleblower's report on the missing funds had everyone talking in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her report was a wake-up call, like a loud whistle blown by a whistleblower.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the whistleblower's report reverberated throughout the company.
